oai_dc:dc.dc:title: RISK-BASED LIFE CYCLE MIM STRATEGY FOR COASTAL STRUCTURES - EFFECT OF PRE-EXISTING DAMAGES ON FAILURE PROBABILITY -
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Horstmann, Nannina
Hinze, Kerstin
Schimmels, Stefan
Oumeraci, Hocine
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: sea dikes
estuary dikes
weak spots
initial damages
failure probability
fault tree analysis
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A risk-based strategy for monitoring, inspection and maintenance (MIM) is described as a key component of an overall framework for life-cycle engineering and management. Its application for coastal structures is exemplarily outlined for sea/estuary dikes and harbor quay walls. The necessity of the incorporation of pre-existing damages into this strategy is exemplarily illustrated for quay walls, showing how this will affect the failure probability in comparison to a quay wall without any pre-existing damages.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 33 (2012): Proceedings of 33rd Conference on Coastal Engineering, Santander, Spain, 2012; structures.57
